title: Altona: Initial Sync suspends with missing requests
body:
**Describe the bug**
Sync Altona and the initial sync suspends with below logs:
```
2020-07-22 15:11:59  [SYNC]             info: Fetching blocks for 14356...14419 slot range
2020-07-22 15:11:59  [SYNC]          verbose: updating block target 14419
2020-07-22 15:11:59  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAmV2BjFPcY4QYRuWE5DxpS2KpfLogiSmVKe9Lp9mTt3XBU requestId=a6c33fc97dd05c77, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAm11SEWpDeBdRVnher3mA1bH8Vqz4E9NnsveYRguSpvkeW requestId=49b192b6c0186441, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAmKvyXP7YTcKfyKHfssLVQDKbCSEMSnf6RnAbwynuBmkE5 requestId=59c294d93b1c3ebc, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAm4E6fMnRfmREDFCmFTcU7AHD2RwTnETSQL3pqVNQx8dQf requestId=806fda07ed81e459, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAm1gPDqPY4qkMvyjSjXWESF8U9S72KesxRxENSYw3QViBD requestId=04816d332943c143, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAm5ZUgecTiQ3qvxBmwT8WGuZead9UKzVKpzcVM563jMsVy requestId=8ab12da36c68bff4, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAmShssfcjghFfXKZZxUnw4Wq5t3thxGpRyU9d2pHfjhQWK requestId=638c1a80d005b33c, encoding=ssz_snappy

2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAmV2BjFPcY4QYRuWE5DxpS2KpfLogiSmVKe9Lp9mTt3XBU requestId=a6c33fc97dd05c77, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":14372,"step":1,"count":8}
2020-07-22 15:12:00  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAm11SEWpDeBdRVnher3mA1bH8Vqz4E9NnsveYRguSpvkeW requestId=49b192b6c0186441, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":14404,"step":1,"count":8}
2020-07-22 15:12:01  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAmKvyXP7YTcKfyKHfssLVQDKbCSEMSnf6RnAbwynuBmkE5 requestId=59c294d93b1c3ebc, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":14380,"step":1,"count":8}
2020-07-22 15:12:01  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 7 chunks from 16Uiu2HAm4E6fMnRfmREDFCmFTcU7AHD2RwTnETSQL3pqVNQx8dQf requestId=806fda07ed81e459, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":14364,"step":1,"count":8}
2020-07-22 15:12:01  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAm5ZUgecTiQ3qvxBmwT8WGuZead9UKzVKpzcVM563jMsVy requestId=8ab12da36c68bff4, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":14356,"step":1,"count":8}
2020-07-22 15:12:01  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAmShssfcjghFfXKZZxUnw4Wq5t3thxGpRyU9d2pHfjhQWK requestId=638c1a80d005b33c, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":14396,"step":1,"count":8}
2020-07-22 15:12:02  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive ping request from 16Uiu2HAmShssfcjghFfXKZZxUnw4Wq5t3thxGpRyU9d2pHfjhQWK requestId=e3cd4fba8e92feef, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-22 15:12:02  [NETWORK]       verbose: Sent response for request e3cd4fba8e92feef
2020-07-22 15:12:03  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAm1gPDqPY4qkMvyjSjXWESF8U9S72KesxRxENSYw3QViBD requestId=04816d332943c143, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":14412,"step":1,"count":8}
```

**Analyse**
+ I see that we have 7 beacon_block_by_range requests and receive back 7 beacon_block_by_range responses
+ Requests for blocks from 14356...14419
+ There are 7 requests: {"startSlot":14356,"step":1,"count":8}, {"startSlot":14364,"step":1,"count":8}, {"startSlot":14372,"step":1,"count":8}, {"startSlot":14380,"step":1,"count":8}, {"startSlot":14396,"step":1,"count":8}, {"startSlot":14404,"step":1,"count":8}, {"startSlot":14412,"step":1,"count":8}
+ Seems like missing a request starting with 14388

We should not have an issue with our `chunkify` work when fetching a block range.

I think this call block us in case of unresponsive peers: `const {stream} = await libp2p.dialProtocol(peerId, protocol) as {stream: Stream};`, that's why we don't see `sending beacon_blocks_by_range request` log for block 14388 and our timeout handler does not have a chance to run.

I tried to print `sending beacon_blocks_by_range request` log before `libp2p.dialProtocol` and got another suspend case:
```
2020-07-23 09:48:38  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAm5ZUgecTiQ3qvxBmwT8WGuZead9UKzVKpzcVM563jMsVy requestId=7ece04f5b6ca5895, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-23 09:48:38  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAmShssfcjghFfXKZZxUnw4Wq5t3thxGpRyU9d2pHfjhQWK requestId=8abd4153afa6cffd, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-23 09:48:38  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAmV2BjFPcY4QYRuWE5DxpS2KpfLogiSmVKe9Lp9mTt3XBU requestId=7c8158459eeb5c49, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-23 09:48:38  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAm6GkAadd3KgQDQrsfGqyDWWktwxEmjXiHQX7giutJ8oQT requestId=738345b175bb3625, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-23 09:48:38  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAm6FBad3xnXj4WkkjpjaQQedn4rCmh8jCww2uw6MSSFNs2 requestId=174cb7311e456662, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-23 09:48:38  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAmEkiNky4neUPnbdMaRXLrYJaombgHiWehf4yHN4G3mBb4 requestId=74771eea27bd64a2, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-23 09:48:38  [NETWORK]       verbose: sending beacon_blocks_by_range request to 16Uiu2HAmPUFvEyKLUecPg3kdZS5RJ27G8K5TwHz3PAe6eFBvgnJF requestId=e7d612097f70fd3f, encoding=ssz_snappy
```
```
2020-07-23 09:48:39  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 5 chunks from 16Uiu2HAmEkiNky4neUPnbdMaRXLrYJaombgHiWehf4yHN4G3mBb4 requestId=74771eea27bd64a2, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":153340,"step":1,"count":9}
2020-07-23 09:48:40  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 6 chunks from 16Uiu2HAm5ZUgecTiQ3qvxBmwT8WGuZead9UKzVKpzcVM563jMsVy requestId=7ece04f5b6ca5895, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":153295,"step":1,"count":9}
2020-07-23 09:48:40  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAm6FBad3xnXj4WkkjpjaQQedn4rCmh8jCww2uw6MSSFNs2 requestId=174cb7311e456662, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":153331,"step":1,"count":9}
2020-07-23 09:48:40  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 7 chunks from 16Uiu2HAmShssfcjghFfXKZZxUnw4Wq5t3thxGpRyU9d2pHfjhQWK requestId=8abd4153afa6cffd, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":153304,"step":1,"count":9}
2020-07-23 09:48:40  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive beacon_blocks_by_range response with 8 chunks from 16Uiu2HAmPUFvEyKLUecPg3kdZS5RJ27G8K5TwHz3PAe6eFBvgnJF requestId=e7d612097f70fd3f, encoding=ssz_snappy, body={"startSlot":153349,"step":1,"count":9}
2020-07-23 09:48:44  [NETWORK]       verbose: receive ping request from 16Uiu2HAmT4wy4fcHbmS8xo1kfEdcWwMUjPF2PaRpKYtqFTcKQaSQ requestId=88095310d533b8c1, encoding=ssz_snappy
2020-07-23 09:48:44  [NETWORK]       verbose: Sent response for request 88095310d533b8c1
2020-07-23 09:48:45  [NETWORK]         error: failed to send request 738345b175bb3625 to peer 16Uiu2HAm6GkAadd3KgQDQrsfGqyDWWktwxEmjXiHQX7giutJ8oQT Error: response timeout
```

This time we sent out 7 requests, received 5, 1 was timed out and then it's suspended, 1 for sure was timed out and we did not handle it.

So we have to start our timer before connecting to the other node, i.e. before `libp2p.dialProtocol`

Opening this again as it happened in my local environment: it's a `dialProtocol` timeout issue as we don't receive a connection/stream after timing out, no error was thrown, and this does not always happen, then sync gets suspended.

Need to confirm if it happens in other environments as well.
Thats impossible, if we dont receice anything from dial it returns error explicitly

I didn't keep it, will do it next time. But its like

`logger.verbose(`sending ${method} request to ${peerId.toB58String()}`, {requestId, encoding});`

without

`logger.verbose(`got stream to ${peerId.toB58String()}`, {requestId, encoding});`

and the sync is suspended
also run with wtfnode so you can see if libp2p has some open handle so we can report bug to them
